intro: Mycetia lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mycetia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. The plant is characterized by its slender, often climbing stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its small, fragrant flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, three-lobed fruits. Mycetia lanceolata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
